alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Henderson; McLean (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:52PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Warrick, Spencer, southeastern Vanderburgh, Henderson, Daviess and northwestern McLean Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 151 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chandler to near Robards. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Newburgh around 155 PM CDT. St. Joseph around 210 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Stanley, Owensboro, Masonville, Whitesville and Knottsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CDT for southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky.
